document.comment: Generated automatically from Godot engine sources.

section.title: TextServerDummy
section.paragraph: A dummy text server that can't render text or manage fonts.

section.title: Description
section.paragraph: A dummy TextServer interface that doesn't do anything. Useful for freeing up memory when rendering text is not needed, as text servers are resource-intensive. It can also be used for performance comparisons in complex GUIs to check the impact of text rendering.
A dummy text server is always available at the start of a project. Here's how to access it:
The command line argument --text-driver Dummy (case-sensitive) can be used to force the "Dummy" TextServer on any project.
